extendedIngredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 1/2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, divided

extendedIngredients.name: fresh mozzarella
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 oz fresh mozzarella, chopped into pieces (regular low moisture mozzarella would be fine too)
metaInformation: (regular low moisture mozzarella would be too)

extendedIngredients.name: kalamata olive
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup chopped kalamata or black olives

extendedIngredients.name: pizza dough
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (16 oz) homemade or store bought pizza dough

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipes.title: Greek Pizza

winePairing.pairingText: Pizza works really well with Sangiovese, Barbera Wine, and Shiraz. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. You could try Cecchi Chianti Classico Riserva di Famiglia. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Cecchi Chianti Classico Riserva di Famiglia
productMatches.description: Chianti Classico Riserva di Famiglia is certainly the most representative wine of Cecchi. Produced only in years in which the grapes reach the quality desired it comes from the area of Castellina in Chianti. The color of excellent limpidity is of an intense ruby red. The aroma reveals broad and ethereal notes of ripe fruit and spices. The structure is elegant.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place pizza stone in oven and rest 30 minutes. Meanwhile combine 1 1/2 Tbsp olive oil and garlic in a small bowl. Spread and shape pizza crust into a 12 - 13 inch round over a sheet of lightly floured parchment paper, while creating a rim along edge of dough. Brush pizza dough evenly with olive oil mixture. Sprinkle evenly with oregano, basil, thyme (leaving rim uncovered with herbs) and season lightly with salt and pepper. Top evenly with mozzarella and feta cheese. Bake in preheated oven 12 - 15 minutes until crust is golden. Meanwhile, saute peppers in a skillet in 1 Tbsp olive oil over medium high heat until tender (you could also just add them on without sauteing). Remove pizza from oven and immediately top with peppers, tomatoes, olives, onion and parsley. Cut into slices and serve.Recipe Source: Cooking Classy

steps.step: Place pizza stone in oven and rest 30 minutes. Meanwhile combine 1 1/2 Tbsp olive oil and garlic in a small bowl.
Spread and shape pizza crust into a 12 - 13 inch round over a sheet of lightly floured parchment paper, while creating a rim along edge of dough.

Brush pizza dough evenly with olive oil mixture. Sprinkle evenly with oregano, basil, thyme (leaving rim uncovered with herbs) and season lightly with salt and pepper. Top evenly with mozzarella and feta cheese.

Bake in preheated oven 12 - 15 minutes until crust is golden. Meanwhile, saute peppers in a skillet in 1 Tbsp olive oil over medium high heat until tender (you could also just add them on without sauteing).
Remove pizza from oven and immediately top with peppers, tomatoes, olives, onion and parsley.
Cut into slices and serve.Recipe Source: Cooking Classy
